p.s: The scene in chapter 24 of the novel The Hate U Give which is written by Angie Thomas and published by Cornelsen in 2019, presents Starr speaking against the police at a demonstration.
The scene starts with Starr, Seven, Chris and Devante meet a demonstration after leaving the car which ran out of gas.

The demonstration is near the place where Khalil died and Starr becomes immediately flashbacks of his death: I stare too hard, the crwod disappears, and I see him lying in the street.The whole thing plays out before my eyes like a horror movie on repeat (ll. 5-7).

The flashback stoppsstops when she hears what the demonstraitorsdemonstrators are shouting: A hairbrush is not a gun! She is back in reality and sees her attorney standing on top of a police car, holding a bullhorn.
After a second flashback Starr starts to scream also A hairbrush is not a gun, at this moment Ms. Ofrah her attorney sees her.
They start talking about the decision that Khalil's murder do not go to jail.
Starr says she wants to do something: Please?During the other protests, I watched.And talked.So now I wanna do something. (l. 30).
Ms. Ofrah shows her that her voice is her biggest weapon and gives her a bullhorn.

After a yelling which comes from a person in the crowd: Don't be scared (l. 46), she feels confident enough to talk; she admitadmits that she is the witness of KhalilsKhalil's death and says that the decision is not fair or right.

Then she speaks to the police: I turn to the cops.'I'm sick of this!Just like y'all think all of usare bad becuase of some people, we think the same about y'all.Until you give us a reason to think Otherwiseotherwise, we'll keep protesting. (ll. 55-56)
She ends her talk with a statement: You hear me?Khalil lived (ll. 60-61).
